content: Construct a sonnet about autumn leaves, ensuring each line begins with a different letter of the alphabet.

Autumn's tapestry unfurls with grace,
Beneath the canopy, a fiery embrace.
Crimson and gold, they dance in the breeze,
Dappled sunlight filters through the trees.

Each leaf a poem, whispered by time,
Falling softly, in nature's chime.
Gently they swirl, in patterns so fine,
Hues of the earth, in harmony combine.

In every rustle, a story is told,
Journeying from branches, to soil's embrace.
Kindling the soul with their transient hold,
Life in decay, finds its own pace.

Majestic spectacle, as seasons align,
Nature's artistry, in autumn's design.
